about.summary: Implementation of gene-level rare variant association tests targeting allelic series: genes where increasingly deleterious mutations have increasingly large phenotypic effects. The COding-variant Allelic Series Test (COAST) operates on the benign missense variants (BMVs), deleterious missense variants (DMVs), and protein truncating variants (PTVs) within a gene. COAST uses a set of adjustable weights that tailor the test towards rejecting the null hypothesis for genes where the average magnitude of effect increases monotonically from BMVs to DMVs to PTVs. See McCaw ZR, Somineni H, Bereket M, Klein C, Karaletsos T, Casale FP, Koller D, Soare TW. (2022) "An allelic series rare variant association test for candidate gene discovery" <doi:10.1101/2022.12.23.521658>.

The COding-variant Allelic Series Test (COAST) operates on the benign missense variants (BMVs), deleterious missense variants (DMVs), and protein truncating variants (PTVs) within a gene. COAST uses a set of adjustable weights that tailor the test towards rejecting the null hypothesis for genes where the average magnitude of effect increases monotonically from BMVs to DMVs to PTVs. (2022) "An allelic series rare variant association test for candidate gene discovery" <doi:10.1101/2022.12.23.521658>.

name: r-allelicseries

about.summary: Implementation of gene-level rare variant association tests targeting allelic series: genes where increasingly deleterious mutations have increasingly large phenotypic effects. The COding-variant Allelic Series Test (COAST) operates on the benign missense variants (BMVs), deleterious missense variants (DMVs), and protein truncating variants (PTVs) within a gene. COAST uses a set of adjustable weights that tailor the test towards rejecting the null hypothesis for genes where the average magnitude of effect increases monotonically from BMVs to DMVs to PTVs. See McCaw ZR, Somineni H, Bereket M, Klein C, Karaletsos T, Casale FP, Koller D, Soare TW. raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.0.4.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-allelicseries
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/AllelicSeries_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/AllelicSeries/AllelicSeries_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 60e60f078e9fd83274ed5462cbb4dc171ccab6a2f968d65fa1bb06133f1437c5

build:
  merge_build_host: true  # [win]
  number: 0
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/r.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}              # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}            # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_cxx') }}      # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - libblas
    - liblapack
    - libgomp                      # [linux]
    - llvm-openmp                  # [osx]
    - r-base
    - r-rnomni
    - r-rcpp
    - r-rcpparmadillo
    - r-skat
  run:
    - r-base
    - {{ native }}gcc-libs         # [win]
    - r-rnomni
    - r-rcpp
    - r-rcpparmadillo
    - r-skat

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('AllelicSeries')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('AllelicSeries')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=AllelicSeries
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  summary: 'Implementation of gene-level rare variant association tests targeting allelic series: genes where increasingly deleterious mutations have increasingly large phenotypic effects. The COding-variant Allelic Series Test (COAST) operates on the benign missense variants (BMVs), deleterious missense variants (DMVs),
    and protein truncating variants (PTVs) within a gene. COAST uses a set of adjustable weights that tailor the test towards rejecting the null hypothesis for genes where the average magnitude of effect increases monotonically from BMVs to DMVs to PTVs. See McCaw ZR, Somineni H, Bereket M, Klein C, Karaletsos T, Casale
    FP, Koller D, Soare TW. (2022) "An allelic series rare variant association test for candidate gene discovery" <doi:10.1101/2022.12.23.521658>.'
  license_family: BSD
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/BSD_3_clause
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

COAST uses a set of adjustable weights that tailor the test towards rejecting the null hypothesis for genes where the average magnitude of effect increases monotonically from BMVs to DMVs to PTVs.
